data.name: Frontend Client (Customer)
data.description: This layer represents the user interface built using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, leveraging frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular. It supports customer-facing features such as user registration and login, menu browsing with item details, order customization and cart functionality. It also supports staff-facing features including secure logins for admins and staff, real-time order visibility and updates, menu item management (add, edit, delete), and basic sales and operational reporting.

threats.title: [T-001] Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-002] Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses, access sales reports, or modify menu items and application configurations.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-003] Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept sensitive data.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: Backend Web App Server
data.description: This component uses Node.js to implement RESTful APIs. It serves as the core logic layer, receiving requests from the frontend and interacting with the database and external services. Responsibilities include authenticating users, processing orders, managing business logic, and coordinating real-time updates.

threats.title: [T-001] Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-002] Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses, access sales reports, or modify menu items and application configurations.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-003] Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept sensitive data.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-004] Order Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could modify order details (e.g., items, quantities, prices, status) in transit or at rest.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-005] Menu Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could alter menu item data (e.g., prices or descriptions) before it is stored in the database.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-006] Sales Report Tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized individuals could alter sales data in the MongoDB Database, leading to falsified reports.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-007] Application Code/Configuration Tampering
threats.description: Malicious modification of the application’s source code, server configurations, or environment variables could introduce backdoors or disable security features.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-008] Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description: A customer could deny placing an order if insufficient logging and non-repudiation controls are in place.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-009] Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff members (Barista, Manager, Administrator) could deny performing actions if audit logs are insufficient, not immutable, or can be tampered with.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-010] Customer PII Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to customer names, contact details, delivery addresses, and order history.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-011] Staff Credential Disclosure
threats.description: Exposure of usernames, passwords, or session tokens for staff members due to insecure storage or unencrypted transmission.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-012] Application Code and Configuration Disclosure
threats.description: Exposure of source code, server configurations, environment variables, or API keys.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-013] Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to sales reports or underlying aggregated sales data.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-014] Web Application Server DoS
threats.description: An attacker could flood the Web Application Server with excessive requests, making it unavailable.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-016] Customer to Staff Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A customer could exploit a vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to Barista, Manager, or Administrator functionalities.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-017] Barista/Manager to Administrator Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A Barista or Manager could exploit a vulnerability to gain Administrator privileges.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-018] Horizontal Privilege Escalation
threats.description: Gaining unauthorized access to another user’s account within the same privilege level.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: Database Server
data.description: MongoDB is used for persistent data storage. It holds structured information such as user profiles, menu items, order records, and staff roles and permissions.

threats.description: An attacker could modify order details (e.g., items, quantities, prices, status) in transit or at rest.

data.name: Third-Party Payment Service
data.description: This module handles integration with an external payment gateway and supports secure transactions (credit/debit cards, e-wallets, online bank transfers). The backend communicates securely with this service to process and verify customer payments.

data.name: Order Confirmation
data.description: Web Application Server sends an order confirmation and status update back to the Customer.

data.name:
Payment
Request
data.description: Web Application Server initiates a payment request, sending tokenized payment information to the Third-Party Payment Service.

data.name: Customize and Submit Order
data.description: Customer selects items, customizes them, and submits the order details to the Web Application Server.

threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: Frontend Client (Admin)
data.description: This layer represents the user interface built using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, leveraging frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular. It supports customer-facing features such as user registration and login, menu browsing with item details, order customization and cart functionality. It also supports staff-facing features including secure logins for admins and staff, real-time order visibility and updates, menu item management (add, edit, delete), and basic sales and operational reporting.

threats.title: [T-001] Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-002] Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses, access sales reports, or modify menu items and application configurations.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: [T-003] Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept sensitive data.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: Backend Web App Server
data.description: This component uses Node.js to implement RESTful APIs. It serves as the core logic layer, receiving requests from the frontend and interacting with the database and external services. Responsibilities include authenticating users, processing orders, managing business logic, and coordinating real-time updates.
